Package utilities

Interface BSTreeADT<E extends Comparable<? super E>>

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BSTReferencedBased
public interface BSTreeADT<E extends Comparable<? super E>>
extends Serializable
Version:
1.1 Created: Nov 27, 2008 Updated: Nov 23, 2019 Class Description: Abstract data type specification for a simple Binary Tree implementation.
Author:
dwatson, kitty

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(E newEntry)
    Adds a new element to the tree according to the natural ordering established by the Comparable implementation.
    void clear()
    Clears all elements currently stored in tree and makes the tree empty.
    boolean contains​(E entry)
    Checks the current tree to see if the element passed in is stored in the tree.
    int getHeight()
    Determines the row height of the tree and returns that value as an integer value.
    BSTreeNode<E> getRoot()
    The node at the root of the Binary Search Tree will be returned.
    Iterator<E> inorderIterator()
    Generates an in-order iteration over the contents of the tree.
    boolean isEmpty()
    Checks if the tree is currently empty.
    Iterator<E> postorderIterator()
    Generates a post-order iteration over the contents of the tree.
    Iterator<E> preorderIterator()
    Generates a pre-order iteration over the contents of the tree.
    BSTreeNode<E> search​(E entry)
    Retrieves a node from the tree given the object to search for.
    int size()
    The number of elements currently stored in the tree is counted and the value is returned.

  • Method Details

    • getRoot

      BSTreeNode<E> getRoot() throws TreeException
      The node at the root of the Binary Search Tree will be returned.
      Returns:
      node stored at the root of tree is returned
      Throws:
      TreeException - if the root is empty.

    • getHeight

      int getHeight()
      Determines the row height of the tree and returns that value as an integer value.
      Returns:
      the height of the tree.

    • size

      int size()
      The number of elements currently stored in the tree is counted and the value is returned.
      Returns:
      number of elements currently stored in tree.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the tree is currently empty.
      Returns:
      returns boolean true if the tree is empty otherwise false.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears all elements currently stored in tree and makes the tree empty.

    • contains

      boolean contains​(E entry) throws TreeException
      Checks the current tree to see if the element passed in is stored in the tree. If the element is found in the tree the method returns true and if the element is not in the tree the method returns false.
      Parameters:
      entry - the element to find in the tree
      Returns:
      returns boolean true if element is currently in the tree and false if the element is not found in the tree
      Throws:
      TreeException - if the tree is empty.

    • search

      BSTreeNode<E> search​(E entry) throws TreeException
      Retrieves a node from the tree given the object to search for.
      Parameters:
      entry - element object being searched
      Returns:
      the node with the element located in tree, null if not found
      Throws:
      TreeException - if the tree is empty

    • add

      boolean add​(E newEntry) throws NullPointerException
      Adds a new element to the tree according to the natural ordering established by the Comparable implementation.
      Parameters:
      newEntry - the element being added to the tree
      Returns:
      a boolean true if the element is added successfully else false
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the element being added is null

    • inorderIterator

      Iterator<E> inorderIterator()
      Generates an in-order iteration over the contents of the tree. Elements are in their natural order.
      Returns:
      an iterator with the elements in the natural order

    • preorderIterator

      Iterator<E> preorderIterator()
      Generates a pre-order iteration over the contents of the tree. Elements are order in such a way as the root element is first.
      Returns:
      an iterator with the elements in a root element first order

    • postorderIterator

      Iterator<E> postorderIterator()
      Generates a post-order iteration over the contents of the tree. Elements are order in such a way as the root element is last.
      Returns:
      an iterator with the elements in a root element last order
